links.title: Toyota Targets 620-Mile Driving Range With Fuel-Cell Concept Car
links.description: Aims to boost range by 50% over current hydrogen-powered sedan Six-seater concept saloon to have autonomous features Toyota Motor Corp. is set to unveil a fuel-cell concept car that aims to offer 50 percent more driving range than its current hydrogen-powered sedan in a technology push that defies a rising wave of battery-powered vehicles.

links.title: Intel Stock Is the Cheapest Way to Play the AI Revolution
links.description: Luke Lango, InvestorPlace Contributor That is a pretty significant breakout from a nearly 3-year trading range. What is pushing it higher? General enthusiasm in semiconductor stocks owing to growth potential in artificial intelligence and autonomous driving is finally starting to find its way into Intel stock. Is this enthusiasm justified?

links.title: How You Should Be Thinking About Autonomous Driving
links.description: It's no secret that automakers and technology companies are putting a lot of money and effort into developing autonomous vehicles: cars and trucks that can drive safely on public roads with no human driver needed. Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors.

links.title: Intel Proposes System to Make Self-Driving Cars Blameless
links.description: Chipmaker offers math-based rules to make robot cars safe Company wants to speed adoption of autonomous technology Intel Corp. has developed a system it says ensures that self-driving vehicles can't cause accidents where they are at fault, an effort to reassure a skeptical public and help speed adoption of driverless cars on the road.

messages.body: $TSLA Piper Jaffray is ultra bullish on Tesla's chances to build a big business in China. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-analyst-tesla-inc-tsla-is-way-ahead-of-everyone-in/

links.title: Analyst: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Is Way Ahead Of Everyone In China
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has the best chance of any foreign manufacturer to build a massive Chinese electric vehicle business. That's according to Piper Jaffray analyst Alexander Potter, who reiterated his Overweight rating on the stock following a recent meeting with a key EV trade group.
